summary: The Housing Innovation Act (H.R. 855) aims to address housing shortages and affordability by establishing an Office of Housing Innovation within the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD). This office will research and disseminate information on innovative housing solutions, coordinate with other federal agencies, and provide technical assistance to local governments. The bill authorizes grant programs for local planning, research and pilot projects, and educational activities related to housing and community development. It allocates $100 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2032, with funds distributed among the grant programs.
